title: Is it (still) possible to join Chado data and Drupal field data in Drupal views?
body:
branch: Tripal 3

I tried to create a Drupal view that would allow me to display both data from Chado and Drupal on a same page without any success. On Tripal 2, this could be achieved using Drupal views relationship between Drupal node and the corresponding Chado table. On Tripal 3, I didn't find the possibility to join those 2 sides.

I can only either create a view on "Chado stock" or create a view on "Accession" for instance, but none of them can "reach the other side of the database".

If you create a "Chado stock"-based view, how could you provide a link to the corresponding Drupal entity?

If you create a "Accession"-based view ("Accession" being the Tripal entity that is related to a type of Chado stock), how could you display the related organism common name (stock.organism_id->organism.organism_id, organism.common_name) for each record or a specific picture (stock.stock_id->stock_dbxref.stock_id/dbxref_id->dbxref.dbxref_id/db_id->db.db_id by filtering on a given db.name)?

I used to do it a lot on my Tripal 2 views but this issue prevents me from migrating to Tripal 3 at the moment.

title: gene/mRNA feature versioning
body:
Hello All,

I have a question about how others are handling sequence feature versions.

I have a group that is developing gene/mRNA models. They are using an ensembl like system for versioning of gene and transcript id. And they want to maintain a history of previous versions.

They plan on incrementing a digit after the id when a new version is generated.

gene nv2m00005394.1
mRNA nv2m00005394.1.mRNA.1

```
Chr11	GFF3Conv	gene	3598792	3603486	.	-	.	Alias=Sox9;Name=nv2m00005394.1;ID=nv2m00005394.1
Chr11	GFF3Conv	mRNA	3598792	3603486	.	-	.	ID=nv2m00005394.1.mRNA.1;Parent=nv2m00005394.1
```


How should I handle this? Create a new feature for each version and mark the old one obsolete? How do I make it easy for users to find the correct ID when they don't know there has been an update?  I have some ideas, but it would require the geneID and mRNAIDs to have different bases, ie nv2g00005394  (change g->m) for gene and nv2m00005394 for mRNA.

Any advice would be fantastic!!!

Thank you!
Sofia

title: General table prefixing issue in chado_query
body:
Tripal Versions: 2.x and 3.x (13/06/2018)
Drupal Version: not relevant
PostgreSQL Version: not relevant
PHP Version: not relevant

In tripal_core.chado_query.api.inc, the chado_query function prefixes tables using the curly brackets {} for Chado tables and square brackets [] for Drupal tables. The following piece of code is currently used:
```
 $chado_schema_name = chado_get_schema_name('chado');
    $drupal_schema_name = chado_get_schema_name('drupal');
    $sql = preg_replace('/\{(.*?)\}/', $chado_schema_name.'.$1', $sql);
    $sql = preg_replace('/\[(\w+)\]/', $drupal_schema_name.'.$1', $sql);
```
This raises 2 issues:
1) when the user wants to use curly or square brackets for other things that table names, it will be a problem. For instance, if I'd like to select any feature with a uniquename that begins with capital A or B, I would write a query like that (use "drush php" for testing):
```
$sql_query = "SELECT * FROM {feature} WHERE uniquename ~ '^[AB]';"
$results = chado_query($sql_query);
drupal_set_message('Query: ' . $results->getQueryString());

```
Such code will in fact return nothing while there should be some results as the query will be turned into:
`SELECT * FROM chado.feature WHERE uniquename ~ '^public.AB';`

Then

2) replacing the square brackets with just "public." will break Drupal behavior: Drupal uses curly brakets arround table names in order to prefix them with the database prefix used by the Drupal installation (@see https://api.drupal.org/api/drupal/includes%21database%21database.inc/7.x ). For some reasons, people may want or need to prefix all Drupal tables with something and removing curly brackets around Drupal table names prevents Drupal from doing its job.
Some people may wonder why using a table prefix: there are many cases in which it can actually be useful. The first one I think of is when you want to share Drupal users between several Drupal instances. It is possible to specify in your settings.php files that the user table are not prefixed while all the other Drupal tables are. Then when a user is created on a Drupal instance or another, it will be also created on other (well it's a bit more tricky than this but it works).


I'm sorry I don't have a pull request to fix that (yet) and I didn't came up with a good solution yet but if people have ideas to discuss for a fix, feel free. I just wanted to raise the issue so it would be known and people having trouble using queries like mines would understand why sometimes, they might not have expected results... (and also, using Tripal prevents them from using Drupal table prefixing feature).

To this end I define a field instance where the widget is of type `text_textfield`, it uses a custom formatter, and it stores the text in type `field_sql_storage`.

title: Tripal Upgrade from 2.x to 3.x - What happens to URLs, URL Aliases and Redirects ?
body:
* Tripal Version:  latest via github
* Drupal Version:  7.56
* PostgreSQL Version: 9.5.10
* PHP Version: 7.1.13

When migrating content from Tripal 2.x to Tripal 3.x you have the option of migrating your old URL aliases from node/<node_id> to bio_data/<entity_id> - ie updating the url_alias table entries.  This option is on the Drupal menu at /admin/tripal/storage/chado/migrate

The work is done here:
https://github.com/tripal/tripal/blob/445cbb56c50fc80f098f82f9f99bee6e73307356/tripal_chado/includes/tripal_chado.migrate.inc#L828

This does not update a redirection from the bio_data/<entity_id> url.

It is possible to set up "bulk update" data paths/URL Alias and redirection from this menu:
/admin/structure/bio_data/manage/bio_data_<bundle_id>

The work is done here:
https://github.com/tripal/tripal/blob/0819c4eb3cae34e6503edeb0ab66f7c503fd3227/tripal/includes/TripalEntityController.inc#L238

This sets up aliases and invokes the redirect module to update a redirect for that URL.

However, you may only use a quite restrictive 5 tokens from the "Available Tokens" list to set up the alias.  

Thus,  it appears to me that you won't be able use your URL pattern(s) from Tripal 2.x.  when using Tripal 3.x unless you plan to manually update the aliases and redirections needed.

I am not clear if this is all by design or otherwise - but I wanted to put it here as an issue having gone through the most recent code etc.

Thanks in advance for any clarity on this.

title: Protein families in Chado
body:
Hi,

I need some help to find a way to store information about a protein superfamily and its subfamilies in a Chado database. 
The overall structure is as follows:

>superfamily
>> family1 
>>>type1 - protein1,  protein2
>>>type2 - protein3
>>>type3 - protein4, protein5

>> family2 
>>> type4 - protein6
>>> type5 - ...
etc.

I was thinking of two ways of doing this: either 1. via a property table or 2. via hierarchy of terms in a cv (is it possible?).

1. Create new terms and use the featureprop table in a way similar to the one described here [https://sourceforge.net/p/gmod/mailman/gmod-schema/thread/1EA7B462-4D38-4628-93CD-BD3303322F29%40gmail.com/#msg36225490](url). But: how do we know that type1 belongs to family1 in this case?  

2. Create a hierarchy of new terms: one for the superfamily and several for subfamilies, where each subfamily has several types. Each protein is then associated with one type (a type is a leaf in the hierarchy). 
Is it possible to define new terms with this hierarchical structure? 

Or is there another way of representing such a classification in Chado/Tripal? 

I have read about the Group module, but did not find how I can use it. There were also some methods on this page [http://generic-model-organism-system-database.450254.n5.nabble.com/Feature-Lists-td460032.html](url), but they are not "hierarchical" in the way that is required. 

I would be grateful for any hints or examples of doing this.

title: Jquery Update
body:
The new cv browser requires jquery_update module to work.  Here's an example:

http://demo.tripal.info/3.x/cv/lookup/SO

We could downgrade it to work with default Jquery that comes with Drupal but I was hoping to avoid that work.  Should we require jquery_update module be enable for Tripal?

title: Dynamic Tripal Pane labels
body:
## Request/Question

Tripal Pane labels that are dynamic and/or can be set by fields.  OR a way to change each organism's tripal pane labels individually. 

## Why I'm requesting it

I have two cases so far where I want the Tripal Pane to have a different display name based on properties of the bundle. One is our "Transcriptome/Genome" field attached to organism, which links out to the corresponding analysis.  They are both analysis unigenes but I split them, entirely because I wanted the tripal pane to say genome/transcriptome as appropriate.

I now have another case, for Jbrowse.  For our draft genomes, Jbrowse is an alignment to a reference. For our reference genomes, Jbrowse is the ref sequence with annotations.  We are thinking about having the tripal pane say something other than Jbrowse for the drafts.  But the only way I know of to do this right now is to create two Jbrowse fields, and put each one in an appropriately labeled Tripal Pane.

title: Adding properties when creating or editing tripal 3 entities
body:
Sorry if this is in the documentation and I missed it, but I believe this feature is missing.

When creating an entity manually via  Content->Tripal Content -> Add Tripal Content, there is no widget for adding properties.  For example when manually creating a biological sample I would want to specify a treatment, or when creating a gene feature I might want to specify an intron start.

Because in each case we're inserting into the base table's prop table (Feature -> Featureprop, biomaterial -> biomaterialprop) I would think theres a universal "property" field for this?

The same goes for the display of properties, actually (presumably managed by the same field).  

  Is the plan that each feature type would implement its own property field?  Or that properties are too generic and need to be implemented as specific fields?  if thats the case, it would be a lot of fields for something like biosample properties

title: Sept 29th online Tripal training
body:
Does anybody happen to have a recording of the training? I wasn't able to follow along with the demonstrations, and I believe solutions to problems I'm currently having were covered.

Thanks,
Blake

title: Conflicting hook
Hooking into Bundle Forms
body:
Hello,

We are wondering if there is a way to hook into the bundle create form to alter the form. For example, when creating a new Gene, we'd like to alter the options of the organisms field programmatically by running an SQL query. Since running SQL is not possible through the GUI, we'd need a way to do this programmatically.

This is most useful to us when modifying fields that Tripal Bundles automatically create using the tripal_create_bundle function. Currently, we can't find a way to alter the form without creating a full blown TripalField to do a simple task.

Does a hook already exists that we can use to alter the form?

Thanks!

title: No Tripal Panes by default when Tripal DS is enabled
body:
When following the Tripal 3 tutorial (http://tripal.info/tutorials/v3.x/installation/tripal), you
1. Install Tripal Core
2. Install Tripal Chado
3. Install Chado schema & prepare chado/drupal (created basic content types including organism)
4. Install Tripal DS

Following this workflow I don't get the default arrangement of Tripal Panes for all the original basic content types created via preparing your Chado/Drupal database. Tripal panes are available as a group formatter and the layout is available but I would have to build the hierarchy myself.

However, any new content types I create (e.g. genetic_marker) will have the default layout. In other words, Any **content types existing before Tripal DS is enabled are not getting a default arrangement**; where as, **content types created after Tripal DS is enabled are**.

This is incongruent with the tutorial which shows the organism and analysis as having Tripal Panes when following the current order of the tutorial doesn't actually produce that effect.

Do we want to apply default grouping on pre-existing Tripal Content Types? We would run the risk of overriding custom settings if we did... That said, if we don't then what about those admin that don't enable Tripal DS to begin with thinking they want to customize everything themselves and then change their mind after realizing how much work it is ;-). Thoughts?
